articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Throughout its grinding seven-month war against Hamas, Israel has pledged to investigate a series of deadly events in which its military forces are suspected of wrongdoing. The commitment comes in the face of mounting claims — from human rights groups and the International Criminal Court 's chief prosecutor — that the country's leaders are committing war crimes in Hamas-ruled Gaza.
articles.title: The Israeli army says it investigates itself. Where do those investigations stand?

articles.author: EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: After his historic guilty verdict in his hush money case, Donald Trump attacked the U.S.
articles.title: Trump's attacks on US justice system after guilty verdict could be useful to autocrats like Putin

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Iran's hard-line former President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad registered Sunday as a possible candidate for the presidential election, seeking to regain the country's top political position after a helicopter crash killed the nation's president.
articles.title: Iran's hard-line former President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad registers for June 28 presidential election

articles.author: DAVID RISING and KEN MORITSUGU
articles.description: SINGAPORE (AP) — Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accused China on Sunday of helping Russia to disrupt an upcoming Swiss-organized peace conference on the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Zelenskyy accuses China of pressuring other countries not to attend upcoming Ukraine peace talks

articles.author: MEGAN JANETSKY and MARK STEVENSON
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Mexicans will likely choose the first female president in the country’s history Sunday between a former academic who promises to further the current leader’s populist policies and an ex-senator and tech entrepreneur who pledges to up the fight against deadly drug cartels.
articles.title: Mexico votes in an election likely to choose the country’s first female president

articles.author: COLLIN BINKLEY
articles.description: ALEXANDRIA, Va. (AP) — On one side of the classroom, students circled teacher Maria Fletcher and practiced vowel sounds. In another corner, children read together from a book. Scattered elsewhere, students sat at laptop computers and got reading help from online tutors.
articles.title: Most US students are recovering from pandemic-era setbacks, but millions are making up little ground

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB and ELISE MORTON
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine imposed emergency power shutdowns in most of the country on Sunday, a day after Russia unleashed large-scale attacks on energy infrastructure and claimed it made gains in the eastern Donetsk province.
articles.title: Energy shutdowns hit Ukraine after Russian attacks target infrastructure

articles.author: MOGOMOTSI MAGOME and GERALD IMRAY
articles.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) — South Africa announced its final election results Sunday that confirmed no party won a majority, and unprecedented coalitions talks were starting to find a way forward for Africa’s most advanced economy.
articles.title: Official results confirm no party won a majority in South Africa's election as coalition talks start

articles.author: RODNEY MUHUMUZA
articles.description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP) — Early last year, Caroline Ikendi was in distress after undergoing an emergency Caesarean section to remove a stillborn baby and save two others. Doctors said one of the preterm babies had a 2% chance of living.
articles.title: A growing community of breast milk donors in Uganda gives mothers hope

articles.author: DAN MERICA
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Democratic National Committee was watching earlier this year as campaigns nationwide were experimenting with artificial intelligence. So the organization approached a handful of influential party campaign committees with a request: Sign onto guidelines that would commit them to use the technology in a “responsible” way.
articles.title: Democrats wanted an agreement on using artificial intelligence. It went nowhere
